Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery slightly grooved vessel, the fabric is grey-black in section, both the interior and exterior are covered with a cream-coloured slip, remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394931) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394931)
